{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3164239,"name":"Jack","username":"jdrevnyak","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/76d3ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-14T05:10:42.421Z","cooked":"

Hi, I just got started with RobotPY and am writing a vision processing program. I created a file called vision.py and imported cscore which has OpenCV bundled in it, this is downloaded and installed on the robot. I am getting an a sqiggle error on “import cv2” and an error in the log.

File “/home/lvuser/py/vision.py”, line 6, in ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ import cv2 ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ ImportError: libopencv_ml.so.406: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

Here is my vision.py code as well anyone know the issue?

Import the camera server

import ntcore
from cscore import CameraServer

Import OpenCV and NumPy

import numpy as np
import cv2

def main():
# Initialize ntcore
inst = ntcore.NetworkTableInstance.getDefault()
inst.startClientTeam(1537)

# Connect to the Limelight network table
limelight_table = inst.getTable('limelight')

# Set Limelight pipeline to use
limelight_table.putNumber('pipeline', 0)

# Set Limelight LEDs to off
limelight_table.putNumber('ledMode', 1)

cs = CameraServer.getInstance()
cs.enableLogging()

# Get a CvSink. This will capture images from the camera
cvSink = cs.getVideo()

# (optional) Setup a CvSource. This will send images back to the Dashboard
outputStream = cs.putVideo("Processed Video", 320, 240)


img = np.zeros(shape=(240, 320, 3), dtype=np.uint8)

# Initialize HOG descriptor for people detection
hog = cv2.HOGDescriptor()
hog.setSVMDetector(cv2.HOGDescriptor_getDefaultPeopleDetector())

while True:
    # Tell the CvSink to grab a frame from the camera and put it
    # in the source image.  If there is an error notify the output.
    time, img = cvSink.grabFrame(img)
    if time == 0:
        # Send the output the error.
        outputStream.notifyError(cvSink.getError())
        # skip the rest of the current iteration
        continue

    # Flip the image horizontally for correct orientation
    img = cv2.flip(img, 1)

    # Perform people detection using HOG descriptor
    found, _ = hog.detectMultiScale(img)

    # Draw bounding boxes around detected people
    for (x, y, w, h) in found:
        cv2.rectangle(img, (x, y), (x + w, y + h), (0, 255, 0), 2)

    # (optional) send some image back to the dashboard
    outputStream.putFrame(img)
","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-14T05:10:42.421Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":138,"reads":63,"readers_count":62,"score":712.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":430205,"topic_slug":"help-with-opencv-in-robotpy","display_username":"Jack","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46258,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/help-with-opencv-in-robotpy/430205/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3164250,"name":"Noelle","username":"No767","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/no767/{size}/231760_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-14T06:28:04.619Z","cooked":"

I may be incorrect, but i suspect the issue is that the libopencv-ml-dev package is not installed. can you verify if those are installed or not ? also the sqiggle error probably has to do w/ vsc not importing it iirc (restart vsc and see if that fixes it or not).

Looks like the RobotPy roborio-opencv packaging is broken. We’ll look into it.

I’m surprised this didn’t come up earlier.

jdrevnyak:

I am getting an a sqiggle error on “import cv2”

FWIW the reason you’re seeing a red squiggly would be because you don’t have OpenCV installed in your development environment. Your editor won’t know what’s installed on your robot.

Thank you so much, is there a work around to installing OpenCV separately?

jdrevnyak:

Is there a work around to installing OpenCV separately

There is a way to do it, but it’s probably the same amount of work as just fixing our package.

I pushed a new version and tested it on my roborio at home, it should work for you:

robotpy-installer download robotpy-opencv==4.6.0+r2
robotpy-installer install robotpy-opencv
jdrevnyak:

I am getting an a sqiggle error on “import cv2”

If you want to install OpenCV locally, I recommend using pip to install opencv-python. It works well on most desktop platforms.

So it did download but I’m not sure if there still is anything wrong.

I am getting this error now when using robot.py and vision.py.

********** Robot program startup complete ********** ﻿

I am just copying and pasting the cscore-intermediate-vision so i’m not sure if it’s outdated or there still is an issue.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-14T19:18:16.184Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":34,"readers_count":33,"score":21.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":430205,"topic_slug":"help-with-opencv-in-robotpy","display_username":"Jack","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/robotpy/examples/tree/main/cscore-intermediate-vision","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"examples/cscore-intermediate-vision at main · robotpy/examples · GitHub","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":11063,"username":"virtuald","name":"Dustin Spicuzza","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46258,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/help-with-opencv-in-robotpy/430205/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3164683,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-14T19:20:40.662Z","cooked":"

The example appears to be out of date, everything is a static method now and there is no getInstance. Here’s the documentation for the CameraServer class:

https://robotpy.readthedocs.io/projects/cscore/en/stable/cscore/CameraServer.html#cscore.CameraServer
